review: Rushmore is a film that is so honest and direct, it's characters so certain in their words and uncompromising in their ways that you can either laugh, or you can sit back and be annoyed by this display of sheer originality. Bill Murray gives the performance of his career in a role that uncovers the darkness of his screen persona. You imagine many of his comic characters act the way Herman Blume does when they are off-screen.
